availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James B. Speed (Louisville, Kentucky, bookkeeper; pvt & lieut 1st Ky Light Artillery USA, clerk for QM Dpt of OH)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, bookkeeper and soldier. Missouri native. Son of William P. Speed and Sarah A. Speed. Student in Cooper County, Missouri, in 1850. Bookkeeper in Louisville in 1863. Served in the 1st Kentucky Light Artillery Regiment (U.S.A.) as private and lieutenant from September 23, 1862, to July 20, 1865. Served as clerk in chief to the Quartermaster's Department of the Department of the Ohio from December 1862 to June 1863.
